title.narrative: IMPROVED SOCIAL SECTOR COHESION

description.narrative: Output 1.2: Improved legislation facilitates the better cohesion of the health, education and social protection services, which contributes to Child Health, Child Protection Systems, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Health Systems Strengthening, Learning Outcomes, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1: Families with children, adolescents, and young people living close to or below the national subsistence minimum are more resilient (to economic and social deprivation, and stress) and they benefit more from equitable access to quality and inclusive social services and transfers

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF LABOUR AND SOCIAL PROTE OF POPULATION OF THE ROK
SPC FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF SOCIAL REHABILITATION

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers: Technical support to government cash transfer system development and expansion (design, targeting, beneficiary selection, grievance mechanism, cash delivery mechanisms like banking, mobiles, community distribution)
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.2: Improved legislation facilitates the better cohesion of the health, education and social protection services

description.narrative: With continuous support of UNICEF, the Ministry of Labor and Social Protection (MLSP) continued coordination of cross-sectoral social work through the Social Work Reference Center and Annual Social Service Workforce (SSWF) Forum, drafting new social protection laws and policies. UNICEF’s technical support covered improvement of SSWF assessment, capacity building of frontline social workers in basic competencies for engagement at individual and community levels. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/01/2021

title.narrative: Availability of protocols of cooperation (including responsibilities) between the health, education, social protection sectors for the provision of integrated services for vulnerable children; protocols are incorporated into the Law on Specialised Social Services and are aligned with internationally accepted standards(41783)

baseline.value: Responsibilities and standards for integrated services are not defined within primary nor secondary legislation, which are pre-requisite to protocols of cooperation

target.value: 2020:Protocols of cooperation for the provision of integrated services are incorporated into the Law on Specialised Social Services and are in accordance with internationally accepted standards

actual.value: 2020:Responsibilities and standards for integrated services are defined within draft Social Code, Law on the status of social worker, National Plan of social assistance which are pre-requisite to protocols of cooperation
